questions.question: After increasing the temperature in your simulation, what was the observed effect on the corrosion rate?
Which metal showed the highest resistance to corrosion in your virtual experiment?
What was the effect of using a higher concentration electrolyte on corrosion rate?
When you increased the exposure time, what happened to the total weight loss of the metal?
Which parameter did you find most influential in accelerating corrosion in your simulation?
What role did the electrolyte play in your experiment?

answers.b: Allowed ion movement and completed the circuit

answers.question: What type of corrosion did you observe when using two different metals in the same electrolyte?
How did changing the metal affect the results of your corrosion experiment?

answers.c: Some metals corroded faster than others

answers.question: Why is it important to control the temperature during corrosion experiments?

answers.b: To ensure consistent and reliable results
answers.d: To change the color of metal

answers.question: What conclusion can you draw about the relationship between electrolyte concentration and corrosion rate?
